briefdescription.para: Construct a linestring from a vector of points.

detaileddescription.para:
Z and M type will be set based on the type of the first point in the vector.
QGIS 3.0

memberdef.argsstring: (const QVector< double > &x, const QVector< double > &y, const QVector< double > &z=QVector< double >(), const QVector< double > &m=QVector< double >(), bool is25DType=false)
memberdef.name: QgsLineString

briefdescription.para: Construct a linestring from arrays of coordinates.

detaileddescription.para: If the z or m arrays are non-empty then the resultant linestring will have z and m types accordingly. This constructor is more efficient then calling setPoints() or repeatedly calling addVertex()

If the z vector is filled, then the geometry type will either be a LineStringZ(M) or LineString25D depending on the is25DType argument. If is25DType is true (and the m vector is unfilled) then the created Linestring will be a LineString25D type. Otherwise, the LineString will be LineStringZ (or LineStringZM) type.

briefdescription.para: Constructs a linestring with a single segment from p1 to p2.
Construct a linestring from list of points.

detaileddescription.para:
This constructor is more efficient then calling setPoints() or repeatedly calling addVertex()
QGIS 3.0

briefdescription.para: Construct a linestring from a single 2d line segment.
Adds a measure to the geometry, initialized to a preset value.

parameterdescription.para: initial m-value for all nodes

briefdescription.para: Adds a curve to a painter path.
Adds a new vertex to the end of the line string.

parameterdescription.para: vertex to add

briefdescription.para: Adds a z-dimension to the geometry, initialized to a preset value.

parameterdescription.para: initial z-value for all nodes

briefdescription.para: Appends the contents of another line string to the end of this line string.

parameterdescription.para: line to append. Ownership is not transferred.

memberdef.name: closestSegment

briefdescription.para: Searches for the closest segment of the geometry to a given point.

parameterdescription.para: specifies the point to find closest segment to
storage for the closest point within the geometry
storage for the ID of the vertex at the end of the closest segment

indicates whether the point lies on the left side of the geometry (-1 if point is to the left of the geometry, +1 if the point is to the right of the geometry, or 0 for cases where left/right could not be determined, e.g. point exactly on a line) false if point is to right of segment)
epsilon for segment snapping

simplesect.para: squared distance to closest segment or negative value on error

briefdescription.para: Converts the geometry to a specified type.
Creates a new geometry with the same class and same WKB type as the original and transfers ownership.

detaileddescription.para:
To create it, the geometry is default constructed and then the WKB is changed.
clone()
3.0

briefdescription.para: Returns a new curve representing a substring of this curve.

detaileddescription.para: The startDistance and endDistance arguments specify the length along the curve which the substring should start and end at. If the endDistance is greater than the total length of the curve then any "extra" length will be ignored.
If z or m values are present, the output z and m will be interpolated using the existing vertices' z or m values.

briefdescription.para: Returns a new line string geometry corresponding to a segmentized approximation of the curve.

parameterdescription.para: segmentation tolerance
maximum segmentation angle or maximum difference between approximation and curve

briefdescription.para: Deletes a vertex within the geometry.

parameterdescription.para: vertex id for vertex to delete

briefdescription.para: Returns the inherent dimension of the geometry.

detaileddescription.para: For example, this is 0 for a point geometry, 1 for a linestring and 2 for a polygon.

briefdescription.para: Draws the geometry using the specified QPainter.

parameterdescription.para: destination QPainter

briefdescription.para: Draws the curve as a polygon on the specified QPainter.

parameterdescription.para: destination QPainter

briefdescription.para: Drops any measure values which exist in the geometry.

simplesect.para: true if m-values were present and have been removed

briefdescription.para: Drops any z-dimensions which exist in the geometry.

simplesect.para: true if Z values were present and have been removed

briefdescription.para: Returns the end point of the curve.
Checks whether this curve exactly equals another curve.
Extends the line geometry by extrapolating out the start or end of the line by a specified distance.

detaileddescription.para:
Lines are extended using the bearing of the first or last segment in the line.
QGIS 3.0

briefdescription.para: Filters the vertices from the geometry in place, removing any which do not return true for the filter function check.

detaileddescription.para: Has no meaning when called on a single point geometry.
Depending on the filter used, this may result in an invalid geometry.

briefdescription.para: Sets the geometry from a WKB string.

detaileddescription.para:
After successful read the wkb argument will be at the position where the reading has stopped.
fromWkt

briefdescription.para: Sets the geometry from a WKT string.
Returns a unique string representing the geometry type.
Inserts a vertex into the geometry.

parameterdescription.para: vertex id for position of inserted vertex
vertex to insert

briefdescription.para: Returns an interpolated point on the curve at the specified distance.

detaileddescription.para: If z or m values are present, the output z and m will be interpolated using the existing vertices' z or m values.
If distance is negative, or is greater than the length of the curve, a nullptr will be returned.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the geometry is empty.
Returns the length of the geometry.
Returns the m value of the specified node in the line string.

parameterdescription.para: index of node, where the first node in the line is 0

simplesect.para: m value of node, or nan if index is out of bounds or the line does not have m values

briefdescription.para: Returns a const pointer to the m vertex data, or a nullptr if the linestring does not have m values.
Moves a vertex within the geometry.

parameterdescription.para: vertex id for vertex to move
new position of vertex

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of nodes contained in the geometry.
Returns the number of points in the curve.
Returns the point and vertex id of a point within the curve.

parameterdescription.para: node number, where the first node is 0
will be set to point at corresponding node in the curve
will be set to the vertex type of the node

simplesect.para: true if node exists within the curve

briefdescription.para: Returns the specified point from inside the line string.

parameterdescription.para: index of point, starting at 0 for the first point

briefdescription.para: Returns a list of points within the curve.
Removes duplicate nodes from the geometry, wherever removing the nodes does not result in a degenerate geometry.

detaileddescription.para: The epsilon parameter specifies the tolerance for coordinates when determining that vertices are identical.

By default, z values are not considered when detecting duplicate nodes. E.g. two nodes with the same x and y coordinate but different z values will still be considered duplicate and one will be removed. If useZValues is true, then the z values are also tested and nodes with the same x and y but different z will be maintained.
Note that duplicate nodes are not tested between different parts of a multipart geometry. E.g. a multipoint geometry with overlapping points will not be changed by this method.
The function will return true if nodes were removed, or false if no duplicate nodes were found.

briefdescription.para: Returns a reversed copy of the curve, where the direction of the curve has been flipped.
Returns the length of the segment of the geometry which begins at startVertex.
Sets the m value of the specified node in the line string.

parameterdescription.para: index of node, where the first node in the line is 0. Corresponding node must already exist in line string, and the line string must have m values.
m value of node

briefdescription.para: Resets the line string to match the specified list of points.

detaileddescription.para:
The line string will inherit the dimensionality of the first point in the list.
points
new points for line string. If empty, line string will be cleared.

briefdescription.para: Sets the x-coordinate of the specified node in the line string.

parameterdescription.para: index of node, where the first node in the line is 0. Corresponding node must already exist in line string.
x-coordinate of node

briefdescription.para: Sets the y-coordinate of the specified node in the line string.

parameterdescription.para: index of node, where the first node in the line is 0. Corresponding node must already exist in line string.
y-coordinate of node

briefdescription.para: Sets the z-coordinate of the specified node in the line string.

parameterdescription.para: index of node, where the first node in the line is 0. Corresponding node must already exist in line string, and the line string must have z-dimension.
z-coordinate of node

memberdef.argsstring: (double hSpacing, double vSpacing, double dSpacing=0, double mSpacing=0) const override
memberdef.name: snappedToGrid

briefdescription.para: Makes a new geometry with all the points or vertices snapped to the closest point of the grid.

detaileddescription.para: Ownership is transferred to the caller.

If the gridified geometry could not be calculated a nullptr will be returned. It may generate an invalid geometry (in some corner cases). It can also be thought as rounding the edges and it may be useful for removing errors. Example: geometry->snappedToGrid(1,1); In this case we use a 2D grid of 1x1 to gridify. In this case, it can be thought like rounding the x and y of all the points/vertices to full units (remove all decimals).
hSpacing
Horizontal spacing of the grid (x axis). 0 to disable.
vSpacing
Vertical spacing of the grid (y axis). 0 to disable.
dSpacing
Depth spacing of the grid (z axis). 0 (default) to disable.
mSpacing
Custom dimension spacing of the grid (m axis). 0 (default) to disable.
3.0

briefdescription.para: Returns the starting point of the curve.
Sums up the area of the curve by iterating over the vertices (shoelace formula).
Swaps the x and y coordinates from the geometry.

detaileddescription.para:
This can be used to repair geometries which have accidentally had their latitude and longitude coordinates reversed.
QGIS 3.2

briefdescription.para: Returns the geometry converted to the more generic curve type QgsCompoundCurve.

simplesect.para: the converted geometry. Caller takes ownership

briefdescription.para: Transforms the geometry using a coordinate transform.

parameterdescription.para: coordinate transform
transformation direction

set to true to also transform z coordinates. This requires that the z coordinates in the geometry represent height relative to the vertical datum of the source CRS (generally ellipsoidal heights) and are expressed in its vertical units (generally meters). If false, then z coordinates will not be changed by the transform.

memberdef.argsstring: (const QTransform &t, double zTranslate=0.0, double zScale=1.0, double mTranslate=0.0, double mScale=1.0) override
memberdef.name: transform

briefdescription.para: Transforms the x and y components of the geometry using a QTransform object t.

detaileddescription.para: Optionally, the geometry's z values can be scaled via zScale and translated via zTranslate. Similarly, m-values can be scaled via mScale and translated via mTranslate.

briefdescription.para: Transforms the vertices from the geometry in place, applying the transform function to every vertex.

detaileddescription.para: Depending on the transform used, this may result in an invalid geometry.

Transform functions are not permitted to alter the dimensionality of vertices. If a transform which adds (or removes) z/m values is desired, first call the corresponding addZValue() or addMValue() function to change the geometry's dimensionality and then transform.

briefdescription.para: Returns approximate angle at a vertex.

detaileddescription.para:
This is usually the average angle between adjacent segments, and can be pictured as the orientation of a line following the curvature of the geometry at the specified vertex.
vertex
the vertex id
rotation in radians, clockwise from north

briefdescription.para: Returns the x-coordinate of the specified node in the line string.

parameterdescription.para: index of node, where the first node in the line is 0

simplesect.para: x-coordinate of node, or 0.0 if index is out of bounds

briefdescription.para: Returns a const pointer to the x vertex data.
Returns the y-coordinate of the specified node in the line string.

parameterdescription.para: index of node, where the first node in the line is 0

simplesect.para: y-coordinate of node, or 0.0 if index is out of bounds

briefdescription.para: Returns a const pointer to the y vertex data.
Returns the z-coordinate of the specified node in the line string.

parameterdescription.para: index of node, where the first node in the line is 0

simplesect.para: z-coordinate of node, or nan if index is out of bounds or the line does not have a z dimension

briefdescription.para: Returns a const pointer to the z vertex data, or a nullptr if the linestring does not have z values.
Default calculator for the minimal bounding box for the geometry.

detaileddescription.para: Derived classes should override this method if a more efficient bounding box calculation is available.

briefdescription.para: Resets the line string to match the line string in a WKB geometry.

parameterdescription.para: WKB type
WKB representation of line geometry

briefdescription.para: Line string geometry type, with support for z-dimension and m-values.
